diff_hunk:
@@ -9,11 +9,10 @@ Here is a simple script which exports a pretrained AlexNet as defined in
 torchvision into ONNX.  It runs a single round of inference and then
 saves the resulting traced model to ``alexnet.onnx``::
 
-    from torch.autograd import Variable
     import torch.onnx
     import torchvision
 
-    dummy_input = Variable(torch.randn(10, 3, 224, 224)).cuda()
+    dummy_input = torch.randn(10, 3, 224, 224).cuda()
body: the idiomatic way to do this now is `torch.randn((10, 3, 224, 224), device='cuda')`, would be great if you could change this :)
body_html: the idiomatic way to do this now is torch.randn((10, 3, 224, 224), device='cuda'), would be great if you could change this :)
body_text: the idiomatic way to do this now is torch.randn((10, 3, 224, 224), device='cuda'), would be great if you could change this :)
